meanings.definition: The act of suspending something from above.
meanings.sent1: The hangings of the plants from the ceiling brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: I watched the hangings of the lanterns sway gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The hangings of the chandelier seemed to dance as the music played.
meanings.sent4: The hangings of the hammock created a cozy spot for an afternoon nap.
meanings.sent5: The hangings of the bird feeder attracted colorful visitors to the garden.

meanings.definition: Decorative pieces of fabric or other material hung on walls.
meanings.sent1: She admired the beautiful hangings of tapestries in the castle.
meanings.sent2: The hangings of the paintings added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The hangings of the curtains fluttered in the breeze like butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The hangings of the flags told the story of the nation's history.
meanings.sent5: The hangings of the quilt displayed intricate patterns and colors.

meanings.definition: Executions by hanging as a form of capital punishment.
meanings.sent1: The town square was silent after the hangings of the criminals.
meanings.sent2: The hangings of the condemned were a grim reminder of justice.
meanings.sent3: The hangings of the outlaws were a warning to those who broke the law.
meanings.sent4: The hangings of the pirates were a spectacle for the crowds.
meanings.sent5: The hangings of the rebels were met with mixed emotions in the town.
